reviews.text: The location and standard is quite brilliant, especially if you don't want to spent too money on hotels. Only a short walk from Bahnhof Zoo. There is a bus stopp right outside the hotel. The bus takes you directly to Alexanderplatz.
reviews.title: Brilliant place

reviews.text: Really friendly staff, and they speak English.
reviews.title: friendly, comfortable, kind

reviews.text: The single rooms are just beside a street with rather a lot of traffic. So if you are a light sleeper, like me, be sure to book room as high up as possible. The doubles are probably much more quiet.
reviews.title: Great Hotel & Great Location

reviews.text: This a 3*+ with some great service above and beyond the call. A very handy location for public transport, shopping and a few good value "neighbourhood" restaurants and bars - and pretty nicely furnished. I had friends staying at the same time so even though we were upgraded for our seven nights (no extra charge) to a junior suite I still saw the double style room we might have had and thought it seemed well planned and comfortable. Being in the suite end was quieter. The newer tower by the restaurant filled up with coachloads of guests - sometimes noisy school trips. Hubby fell ill on our 2nd day and the reception staff found us medical help, gave lots of good advice and kept an eye on him for the rest of the trip. Housekeeping were diligent and high standard, the mini bar was well stocked and reflected local shop prices. Tried the restaurant first morning/afternoon for buffet lunch - very dull and not great value - never tried breakfast or the hotel coffee shop. Great bakery/coffee bar round the corner on Keithstrasse. We paid £50/night for a double and got excellent accomodation and service. 90% of the staff we met embarrassed me with their excellent English thank goodness - my German's still not too good!
reviews.title: Fantastic value for money
Nice little hotel in a good location
reviews.text: Stayed at the Sylter Hof for New Year. My friends had a double room and I had a single. My room overlooked the main road and wasnt noisy at all. Only thing was, the window let in a draught so I had to keep wrapped up at night but that wasn't too bothersome.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from a 5 day city break in Berlin and we had a great time, found the hotel (pronounced zoolterhof) in venere.com
reviews.title: good hotel in a good location

reviews.text: Getting there from Schonefeld Airport was quite easy ,and enjoyable, the RE7 express to the station at the zoo and then the bus 100 (3 stops)right to the door of the hotel (fare 2.10 euros each from the airport!- magic!
reviews.title: Enjoyed my stay

likes.liked: — Size, the Junior Suite is large and comfortable

reviews.text: We were made to feel very welcome on our arrival - I was a bit embarresed by not being able to speak German, but everyone could speak English
reviews.title: Old hotel, old rooms...

reviews.text: Our room was on the 5th floor , nice and bright ,spacious and clean, we liked the little bag of Haribo Bears on the bed each evening.
reviews.title: UNSAFE - Beware!

reviews.text: We did not eat at the hotel as I had heard breakfast was expensive , instead we had breakfast at a local cafe /take a way just round the corner and also at a kiosk at Wittenbergplatz station about 400m away. For dinner we discovered a great local restaurant 2 streets away in Bayreutherstrasse called the Restaurant Berlinerchen- this was great and we had some great local cuisine.
reviews.title: Dissapointed

reviews.text: We left it quite late booking a hotel for new year and stumbled across this one. We chose it mainly because it was not too expensive and in a good location. Considering this we were very pleased with the hotel when we arrived.
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked with booking.com and got a rate including breakfast for a junior suite. It was only 10 euros more a night for a suite so it seemed worth it.
reviews.title: We liked it

likes.disliked: — The busy road facing the hotel

reviews.text: The suite was massive with a fantastic lounge with leather sofas and a view over the western side of Berlin. It was on the 15th floor (of 16) which is higher than most buildings in Berlin.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: The room was a bit warm but we found the thermostat for the radiators and managed to sort it out.
reviews.title: Very good hotel - centrally located

likes.liked: — Tremendous amount of sace in the apartments.
likes.disliked: — Not enough air conditioning during the very hot weather.

reviews.text: We found the pillows a bit thin - we asked at reception and they brought us some more within half an hour.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: Booked 2 double rooms for a weekend stay in Berlin for ourselves and my parents visiting us. Was pleasantly suprised to be upgrade to the Suites (both rooms). This was in the 14th floor. The rooms was huge with an attached kitchen and small eating area. Nevertheless they were musty and smelt of having not been occupied for a long time. The hotel is close to the center of West Berlin. We travelled by car, so was not a problem with this. We avoided the expensive breakfast as there are some nice cafes in the surroundings where one can have b'fast for half the cost. Overall satisfied for the 2 nights and 3 days we spent in Berlin
reviews.title: Decent Hotel for Short Stays Only

reviews.text: I stayed in the hotel for 1 night and I can tell you that it was horrible! I had a single room with a single bed. The bed was so tiny that I couldn't turn. I did not sleep the whole night because of the noice from the streets. The windows are really thin so you hear constantly cars, people etc. etc. It was 19 C that day but the room was like 30 C. There is NO airco so it was way too warm! My room smelt very dirty and the interior is really old. Berlin is a great city so dont let it be ruined by sleeping in this horrible place. I would not even recommend it to my worst enemy...
reviews.title: Horrible!

likes.disliked: — Everything, just a horrible place! Do not go there..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a few nights at the end of a trip that had started in Estonia and made it's way through europe from there. Our flights were very cheap and we had previously been staying with friends so we splashed out on this hotel instead of going with the usual hostel or budget accommodation. Even though I loved the hotel I did feel that we weren't as welcome there as you would expect:
reviews.title: Lovely place, pity about the staff

reviews.text: When we arrived they tried to charge us a more expensive price than the one we had agreed when booking and after a bit of arguing and the print out of our booking confirmation they finally backed down however they were then very strict about getting payment up front off us even though they had my credit card details. The waiting staff in the breakfast room were rude and on one occasion when we came down for breakfast they refused us telling us that we had already had breakfast that day and again we had to argue the truth before they realised that there was a mistake on their records.
reviews.title: Still a good place to stay
Not bad hotel - Berlin is lovely !
reviews.text: Despite all of this I'd still give the hotel 4 out of 5, as the rooms are beautiful, clean and spacious and the breakfast was delicious and had such a great selection. The location too is great (very close to the Zoo) and allows you to reach all the top attractions by the nearby train station (the public transport is great in Berlin).
